cluster_name.description: A unique identifier for the head node and workers of this cluster.

min_workers.description: DEPRECATED. Use the per node_type min_workers field instead.

max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers nodes to launch in addition to the head node. This takes precedence over min_workers.

upscaling_speed.description: The autoscaler will scale up the cluster faster with higher upscaling speed. E.g., if the task requires adding more nodes then autoscaler will gradually scale up the cluster in chunks of upscaling_speed*currently_running_nodes. This number should be > 0.

idle_timeout_minutes.description: If a node is idle for this many minutes, it will be removed.

module.description: module, if using external node provider

head_ip.description: gcp project id, if using gcp

msi_identity_principal_id.description: User-defined managed identity principal id (generated by config)

autoscaler_service_account.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

autoscaler_role.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

autoscaler_role_binding.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

cache_stopped_nodes.description: Whether to try to reuse previously stopped nodes instead of launching nodes. This will also cause the autoscaler to stop nodes instead of terminating them. Only implemented for AWS.

disable_node_updaters.description: Disables node updaters if set to True. Default is False. (For Kubernetes operator usage.)

gcp_credentials.description: Credentials for authenticating with the GCP client

type.description: Credentials type: either temporary OAuth 2.0 token or permanent service account credentials blob.

credentials.description: Oauth token or JSON string constituting service account credentials

CLOUDWATCH_AGENT_INSTALLED_AMI_TAG.description: Tag to be added to cloudwatch agent pre-installed AMI name.

config.description: Path to Unified CloudWatch Agent config file. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/CloudWatch-Agent-Configuration-File-Details.html for additional details.

max_attempts.description: Max allowed Unified CloudWatch Agent installation attempts on any host.

delay_seconds.description: Seconds to wait between each Unified CloudWatch Agent installation attempt.

config.description: Path to CloudWatch Dashboard config file. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/CloudWatch-Dashboard-Body-Structure.html for additional details.

auth.description: How Ray will authenticate with newly launched nodes.

ssh_proxy_command.description: A value for ProxyCommand ssh option, for connecting through proxies. Example: nc -x proxy.example.com:1234 %h %p

docker.description: Docker configuration. If this is specified, all setup and start commands will be executed in the container.

run_options.description: shared options for starting head/worker docker

head_image.description: image for head node, takes precedence over 'image' if specified

head_run_options.description: head specific run options, appended to run_options

disable_automatic_runtime_detection.description: disable Ray from automatically using the NVIDIA runtime if available

disable_shm_size_detection.description: disable Ray from automatically detecting /dev/shm size for the container

head_node_type.description: If using multiple node types, specifies the head node type.

head_node.description: Provider-specific config for the head node, e.g. instance type.

worker_nodes.description: Provider-specific config for worker nodes. e.g. instance type.

file_mounts.description: Map of remote paths to local paths, e.g. {"/tmp/data": "/my/local/data"}

cluster_synced_files.description: List of paths on the head node which should sync to the worker nodes, e.g. ["/some/data/somehwere"]

file_mounts_sync_continuously.description: If enabled, file mounts will sync continously between the head node and the worker nodes. The nodes will not re-run setup commands if only the contents of the file mounts folders change.

rsync_exclude.description: File pattern to not sync up or down when using the rsync command. Matches the format of rsync's --exclude param.

rsync_filter.description: Pattern files to lookup patterns to exclude when using rsync up or rsync down. This file is checked for recursively in all directories. For example, if .gitignore is provided here, the behavior will match git's .gitignore behavior.

metadata.description: Metadata field that can be used to store user-defined data in the cluster config. Ray does not interpret these fields.

initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

setup_commands.description: List of common shell commands to run to setup nodes.

head_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on the head node after common setup.

worker_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on worker nodes after common setup.

head_start_ray_commands.description: Command to start ray on the head node. You shouldn't need to modify this.

worker_start_ray_commands.description: Command to start ray on worker nodes. You shouldn't need to modify this.

no_restart.description: Whether to avoid restarting the cluster during updates. This field is controlled by the ray --no-restart flag and cannot be set by the user.

available_node_types.description: A list of node types for multi-node-type autoscaling.

node_config.description: Provider-specific config for the node, e.g. instance type.

initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

worker_setup_commands.description: List of common shell commands to run to setup nodes. This node specfic list will override the global setup_commands and worker_setup_commands.

worker_run_options.description: analogous to head_run_options, merged with the global docker run_options.
